action.action-desc: Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to complete a study on the human health implications of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) contamination in drinking water.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Investing in Testing Act of 2017.

section.header: Study by CDC on health implications of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances contamination in drinking water

subsection.text: The Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention shall—

paragraph.text: not later than 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act, commence a study on the human health implications of per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) contamination in drinking water; and
not later than 2 years and 60 days after the date of enactment of this Act—

subparagraph.text: submit a report to the Congress on the results of such study.

subsection.text: To carry out this Act, there is authorized to be appropriated $15,000,000.
